jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

96A684A0E8E24F4BA86201A17BD89660.description:
Locate places where
important events took place.

A0DF48C2C1964AD09D725B1645E7DF76.description:
Tell about a myth, legend,
or story that people told to
describe the physical
environment of a place or
region in Illinois, U.S. or
world.

5947867BA5514CF680CF2E3B0065660E.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world environmental history (United States/World). Understand how Church belief regarding creation and God’s providence shape history of United States and the world. Demonstrate a general understanding of the “story” of humanity from creation to present through a Catholic concept of the world and man.
CSGS1
Relate how history begins and ends in God and how history has a religious dimension. CSIS1

0AE68A506E2B459EBEEF503892024CEB.description:
Name organizations that help
to improve community life
(e.g., Red Cross,
YWCA/YMCA, St. Vincent
DePaul, CCW, Knights of
Columbus).

95157B123D8541CD9CEB1034137E9CE5.description:
Tell how past traditions show
how various customs
influence society, including
Church traditions.

47DF1052608A4DEDBE6847EF0FD233F8.description:
Tell how stories and folktales
influence people.

0D891F3FAE94456EAA7347B9C00206F8.description:
Identify stories and folktales
that describe various customs
and practices of the Church,
state, country, and world.

191D5E977D8B4A3CBE61844DE86B940A.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world social history (United States/World). Understand social history of Church, Illinois, United States, and world. Demonstrate an understanding about great figures of history by examining their lives for examples of virtue. CSGS2
Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5

FE52B1A9E7F647878A490A903AEBD6DA.description:
Tell why doing the right thing
is important to all people.
Give examples.

A2138A512FDA465F8F6695242EA7B7C1.description:
Tell ways people make
choices to survive and
improve their lives in past and
present.

D3E19348912743CF8344B33482981894.description:
Describe how people made a
living in the past.

82D9B0D159E14062A6B2C32637A09EBB.description:
Explain why people traded in
the past.

74FCEB8740CB4E80B283C4242557A791.description:
Understand the development of economic systems (United States/World). Understand how moral or religious thought contributed to the development of economic systems. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7
Discuss how history can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12

7836BEA6DEE14F9DAF6E7991C9C9A11B.description:
Tell how a past event has
influenced their life.

456F1DE665DD4771BBE1EC3F2C12A62B.description:
Identify a local and/or
historical monument or place.

75111207BD264559ACBFB8E61A1B97DF.description:
Name a significant idea or
event from the past.

3450283D1E0E40A5B3DB2ED4738FDDA9.description:
Identify key people in the
history of the Church and tell
why they were important.

AE839B2AA84D497CBADEEB3290E4D689.description:
Identify key people in local,
U.S. and/or world history.

00884200AD2C4BD0ADF63206A4E1B65B.description:
Understand the development of significant political events (United States/World). Understand the development of significant Church or religious events. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4
Exhibit knowledge of essential dates, persons, places and facts, especially those relevant to the western traditions. CSIS

0B615C95C9D242BFB323232E440D11AE.description:
Explain why people need to
know about the history of
those who live in other places.

02D7B7A0732A40B6AD36C6C024BC2F0A.description:
Tell what it was like for a
saint during their time.

2E619176DE1F4E629FB2B660CE978B7E.description:
Use a story or an image about
the past to describe what life
was like for people who lived
during that period.

80BC84401D9D4781B23F1BF7F6557BA6.description:
Explain how the individual
events on a timeline are
related to one another.

B723C403486B4C24AAC428FC5A060C77.description:
Place a series of events from a
chronology (e.g., the student's
life, Jesus’ life) in their proper
places on a timeline.

F417C41D916041BD8ACAC357CF5483CF.description:
Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation. Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation to religious events, trends and Church individuals and movements. Relate that Jesus, as God incarnate, existed in history just like we do. CSIS2
Describe how reading history is a way we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3

08D7638C194741E6A022A544B3C6E762.description: Understand events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of Illinois, the United States and other Nations. Understand religious events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of the United States, other Nations and the Church.
